business.headline: Retail inflation hits six-year low, falls to 2.82% in May 2025The decline in retail inflation is mainly because food prices rose at a much slower pace than before. Cheaper vegetables, fruits, cereals, and pulses helped bring food inflation down sharply. In May, food inflation fell to 0.99% from 1.78% in April.

Sensex tanks 823 points, Nifty falls below 25,000; Tata Motors falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 823.16 points to close at 81,691.98, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 253.20 points to settle at 24,888.20.

Boeing reacts to Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad, says aware of initial reportsThe London-bound flight AI-171, carrying 242 people including 230 passengers and 12 crew members, crashed in the Meghaninagar area near the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport minutes after takeoff. The plane had issued a mayday call before losing contact with air traffic control.

Shocked and deeply saddened: Gautam Adani after Air India plane crash in AhmedabadOn Thursday afternoon, an Air India flight heading to London crashed just minutes after take-off, with 242 people on board. The flight, AI-171, was being operated by a Boeing 787 Dreamliner.

Focus on supporting affected people: Tata Group chief on Ahmedabad plane crashThe airplane crash has led to a temporary suspension of flight operations at Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport.

Boeing shares tumble 8% after Air India flight crashes in AhmedabadBoeing shares nosedived over 8% in pre-market trade after the Air India Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad, deepening investor concerns over the jetmaker's safety record and regulatory troubles.

Google offers buyout plans amid AI-focused overhaul: ReportGoogle is now giving some employees the option to leave the company with a severance package. This is being called a "voluntary exit programme", as per reports.

Dalal Street dips nearly 1 percent on global trade and geopolitical concernsStock market today: The fall occurred despite markets erasing early losses as the S&P BSE Sensex fell by 911 points to 81,603.95 and the NSE Nifty50 lost 288.75 points to 24,854.45 by 2:29 pm.

India to tighten remittance rules, bar offshore time deposits: ReportThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will amend regulations to prevent overseas transfers from being used to park money in time deposits or other interest-bearing accounts abroad, one of the sources said.

PM-Kisan 20th instalment: When will farmers get the next Rs 2,000?This scheme provides income support of Rs 6,000 a year to eligible farmers. The money is paid in three equal parts of Rs 2,000, directly into the farmers' bank accounts.

Dollar dream vs reality: Why Rs 80 lakh in US salary not as big as it soundsRs 23 lakh in India can go as far as Rs 80 lakh in the US when it comes to daily living costs. An upcoming author reveals the impact of Purchasing Power Parity (PPP) on salary comparisons between India and the US.
Elon Musk's net worth jumps after apology to Donald TrumpElon Musk's net worth increased by $191 million, reaching $411.4 billion after his public apology to President Donald Trump.

Got an income tax notice? Don't panic, here's how to deal with itFor many honest taxpayers, the unexpected arrival of an income tax notice in their inbox can trigger anxiety. However, most of them are often routine and manageable. This article explains what these notices really mean, why they're sent, and what you should do if one lands your way.

India's AI market to triple by 2027 with strong talent and tech growthThe report, titled "India's AI Leap: BCG Perspective on Emerging Challengers," indicates that the country is set to become one of the fastest-growing AI economies globally.

Paytm shares slide up to 10% after government dismisses MDR rumoursPaytm shares fell sharply in early trade after the government rejected reports suggesting the return of merchant discount rate (MDR) charges on UPI transactions.

Tanla Platforms shares jump 13% today. Check what's driving the rallyTanla Platforms share price: At around 10:10 am, shares of the company were trading 9.96% higher at Rs 684.20 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

India, EU nearly 90% ready on market access in FTA talks, says Piyush GoyalPiyush Goyal also underlined the political backing behind the deal, referring to the meeting between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen in New Delhi on 28 February.
Sensex, Nifty erase early losses to trade in green; IT stocks limit gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up by 89.24 points to 82,604.38, while the NSE Nifty50 added 31.45 points to 25,163.80 as of 9:27 am.

Stock market today: Sensex and Nifty likely to open flat. Here's whyAs of 8:34 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,236.5, suggesting that the Nifty 50 index will open close to Wednesday's closing level of 25,141.4.

Stocks to watch on June 12: Wipro, HDFC Bank, IREDA, Nazara Tech, NTPCThe Sensex and Nifty closed higher after a rangebound session on Wednesday. While gains in IT stocks supported the indices, profit booking and the absence of strong triggers limited the overall rise.

Dubai's billionaire realty map: Can India's salaried class invest there?For years, Dubai's skyline has glittered like a dream, much like that tempting NRI cousin who always seemed a step ahead in life. But things are changing as salaried Indians are looking to venture into Dubai's posh real estate.
Sensex closes 123 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; HCLTech gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 123.42 points to end at 82,515.14, while the NSE Nifty gained 37.15 points to close at 25,141.40.

Bharat rising: Why Tier-2 cities drive job growth, explains HireVeda co-founderWhile the metros still lead in the number of jobs, the speed of growth in smaller cities is hard to ignore, noted co-founder of HireVeda and ExecEdge.

India now home to over 85,000 millionaires, ranks 4th globally: ReportIndia now trails only the United States, China, and Japan in terms of the number of wealthy individuals, accounting for 3.7% of the global HNWI population.

Digital Form 16: Step-by-step guide to download and use it for easy ITR filingWith the advent of digital platforms, accessing and using Form 16 has become more straightforward, making it a vital document for accurate and hassle-free income tax return (ITR) filing.

Chasing Rs 10 discounts? CA explains why tracking every rupee isn't making you richIt's a common belief that managing every rupee wisely equals financial discipline. People cut back on little indulgences and chase discounts, feeling financially in control, yet, their money may be slipping away in unnoticed ways.

Baba Kalyani says 'Make in India' gave Bharat Forge a breakthrough in defenceBaba Kalyani believes India's defence future will be built on indigenous talent, technology, and trust in private enterprise.

Paramount to cut 3.5% of US jobs as cable TV declines: ReportThis is not the first round of job losses at Paramount. Back in August last year, the company had already cut 15% of its workforce, indicating ongoing adjustments in response to market changes.

Law tribunal clears merger of Inox Wind Energy Limited with Inox WindThe merger is expected to reduce liabilities by around Rs 2,050 crore. The company also expects to save costs by improving how resources are used and by simplifying various processes.
Sensex opens 86 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; RIL gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 104.24 points to 82,495.96, while the NSE Nifty50 added 36.70 points to 25,140.95 as of 9:31 am.

Oswal Pumps IPO to open soon with Rs 1,387 crore target. Check detailsOswal Pumps is launching an IPO aiming to raise Rs 1,387.34 crore. Here are essential details potential investors need to consider before subscribing.

Tariff cuts, easing digital barriers: India, US make headway in trade talksBoth nations are aiming for an interim trade pact by the end of June, before the pause on Trump's proposed tariffs expires. India is advocating for full exemption from a 26% reciprocal tariff on domestic goods.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty open higher today? Check key levelsSensex and Nifty closed flat on Tuesday, ending a four-day winning streak. The flat close was largely due to profit booking, especially in financial stocks.
Stocks to watch on June 11: Wipro, Reliance Infra, IndiGo, Maruti SuzukiExperts suggest that the positive sentiment is likely to persist on Dalal Street with the key support level of Nifty at 24,850.

World Bank slashes global growth forecast, cites higher tariffs and uncertaintyIn its twice-yearly Global Economic Prospects report, the bank lowered its forecasts for nearly 70 per cent of all economies as well as six emerging market regions, from the levels it projected just six months ago before US President Donald Trump took office.

Applying for a personal loan? How many years of ITRs do you needBanks need to be sure you can pay back the money you borrow. For salaried individuals, a regular pay cheque and Form 16 usually provide enough assurance. However, for self-employed individuals, ITRs over several years give a more consistent and reliable picture of earnings and financial health.
Raymond Realty likely to list in early July, says chairman Gautam SinghaniaEach shareholder will receive one share of Raymond Realty for every share held in Raymond, the group said previously.

Sensex, Nifty end flat as profit booking halts rally; IT gains capped by banksThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 53.49 points to end at 82,391.72, while the NSE Nifty50 ended flat with a gain of 1 point to 25,104.25.

Mutual fund inflows fall: Should beginners still trust SIPs or go for stocks?Data from the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) shows that net inflows into equity schemes dropped 22% month-on-month to Rs 19,013 crore in May, marking the fifth straight month of decline and the weakest level since April 2024.

India emerges as Apple's new bet, but China and Trump raise red flags: ReportLast week, Foxconn announced a fresh $1.5 billion investment in its Indian operations, offering some reassurance to officials in New Delhi. This move may ease tensions in New Delhi that began when Donald Trump publicly stated he told Tim Cook not to expand Apple's manufacturing in India, casting doubt on hopes that most iPhones for the US would be made in India by 2026.

entertainment.headline: Bobby Deol shares rare pic of Dharmendra and Prakash Kaur on their 71st anniversaryActor Bobby Deol shared a rare picture of his parents, actor Dharmendra and his first wife, Prakash Kaur, on social media. His post marked the 71st wedding anniversary celebration of his parents.

No human damage: Actor Nikhil Siddhartha reacts after India House set accidentA water tank burst flooded the set of Ram Charan's maiden production 'The India House', causing significant damage but no loss of life. Lead actor Nikhil Siddhartha and producer Abhishek Agarwal confirmed the safety of all involved and thanked the crew for their quick response.

Why Jitendra Kumar's leadership from Kota to Phulera prove not all heroes wear capesJitendra Kumar's roles as Jeetu Bhaiya in 'Kota Factory' and Abhishek in 'Panchayat' have quietly redefined how mentorship and leadership are portrayed on screen. Through empathy and simplicity, he's become a relatable guide for both students and senior citizens across India.

Keerthy Suresh's action‑comedy Revolver Rita to release in August. Promo outFollowing her Bollywood debut in 'Baby John', Keerthy Suresh returns to Tamil cinema with her upcoming quirky action-comedy 'Revolver Rita', set to hit theatres in August.

Who is Elijah Cooper, Zahara Jolie-Pitt's rumoured fiance? All you need to knowAngelina Jolie and Brad Pitt's daughter Zahara sparked a social media frenzy after being seen at the celebrity hotspot Craig's with her rumoured boyfriend, Elijah Cooper, wearing a diamond ring. This sighting has left fans buzzing with questions, especially: who is Elijah Cooper?

Salman Khan's event, Kannappa trailer launch postponed after Ahmedabad plane crashSalman Khan's event and the 'Kannappa' trailer launch were called off after an Air India flight to London crashed just five minutes after takeoff from Ahmedabad's Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport on Thursday afternoon.

Big B's playful reaction to director saying he spoiled industry's work templateActor Amitabh Bachchan recently shared a light-hearted conversation with one of the directors of his ad film. In his playful blog post, he admitted how people felt he might spoil the industry's work template.

Sabrina Carpenter faces backlash over controversial Man's Best Friend album coverSinger Sabrina Carpenter invited criticism over the album cover of 'Man's Best Friend'. Several social media users claimed that the cover is degrading and caters to the male gaze.

Diljit Dosanjh's Sardaar Ji 3 in trouble over casting row, film body urges banDiljit Dosanjh's upcoming film 'Sardaar Ji 3' faces trouble as FWICE urges CBFC to deny certification over alleged casting of Pakistani actors. The controversy comes amid rising Indo-Pak tensions, following a government advisory against such collaborations.

Ahmedabad plane crash: Allu Arjun, Akshay Kumar, Alia Bhatt, celebs mourn the lossAn Air India flight bound for London crashed five minutes after take-off from Ahmedabad airport on Thursday afternoon. Shortly after the news broke, concerns, support, and prayers began pouring in from film celebrities, including Allu Arjun, Akshay Kumar, Alia Bhatt, Riteish Deshmukh and Randeep Hooda, among others.

The Better Sister deepens what Adolescence taught us about child psychology'The Better Sister' on Prime Video has created buzz for its suspense and courtroom drama. However, the show also gives insight into parenting, therapy, childhood trauma and marital abuse. Here's a glimpse into how the show has a subtle take on teenage struggles post Netflix' 'Adolescence'.

After BTS's Jimin and Jungkook, ARMY awaits Suga's returnK-pop's biggest boyband BTS is all set to reunite, as every member except for Suga has been discharged from the mandatory military service. Suga will be discharged later this month.

Diljit Dosanjh hints at desi Hips Don't Lie collaboration with Shakira. WatchSinger Diljit Dosanjh hinted at the possibility of a collaboration with pop sensation Shakira for the Indian version of her song 'Hips don't lie'. The duo met at the Met Gala earlier this month.

Kajol rules out DDLJ 2: No one wants to know what happens after train leftKajol recently shared her thoughts on possible sequels to her iconic films 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' and 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai'. She feels that some love stories are best left as they are.

Kapil Sharma didn't have identity, got show because of me: Navjot Singh SidhuFormer cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu revealed that he played a key role in helping Kapil Sharma land his big break. He also opened up about the real reason behind his participation in 'Bigg Boss' back in 2012.

The Bengal Files teaser: A chilling story with powerhouse performersIn 'The Bengal Files' teaser, you see a glimpse of all the prominent characters in the film. It further promises a rigid, dark and unsettling tone for the film directed and written by Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri.

Venkatesh first, Jr NTR next: Producer confirms director Trivikram's line-upAmid growing speculation about his next collaborations, director Trivikram Srinivas' long-time associate and producer Naga Vamsi has officially clarified the filmmaker's upcoming line-up on social media.

Hrithik Roshan and family host Jackson Wang for dinner. See picActor Hrithik Roshan and his family invited Korean singer Jackson Wang for a dinner on June 11. Rakesh Roshan shared a picture from the dinner on social media.

BTS fan tries to break into Jungkook's house hours after military dischargeA BTS fan was arrested for unlawfully entering Jungkook's residence following his military discharge. The singer was officially discharged on Wednesday after an 18-month-long mandatory service.

general news.headline: Air India crash: Plane's final moments recorded in radar dataThe plane, as seen in videos, was struggling to gain altitude before veering sharply and descending rapidly, followed by a loud explosion and a massive fireball as the aircraft crashed.

Heartbreaking beyond words: PM Modi on Ahmedabad-London Air India flight crashReacting to the Air India crash in Ahmedabad, Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed sorrow over the incident. Calling the incident "heart-breaking beyond words", Modi said he was in touch with authorities coordinating rescue and relief efforts at the crash site.

Video: Part of Air India plane hangs out of resident doctors' hostel after crashA part of the Air India flight, which crashed shortly after take-off from Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport in Ahmedabad, fell on BJ Medical College's resident doctors' hostel roof in Ahmedabad.

Air India flight crashed 5 minutes after its take-off: What we know so farAn Air India flight bound for London crashed shortly after take-off from the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport in Ahmedabad on Thursday afternoon. The aircraft, a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner operating as Air India 171, was carrying 242 people, including 230 passengers and 12 crew members.

Mayday, Mayday Air India declared, then radio silence: Tracing Ahmedabad crashThe Air India Ahmedabad-London flight gave a mayday call to ATC, moments before it crashed near the Ahmedabad airport, the DGCA said in a statement.
Air India profile pics go black after London-bound flight crashes in AhmedabadAn Air India flight to London crashed five minutes after take-off from the Ahmedabad airport on Thursday afternoon.

Devastating scenes, thoughts with passengers: UK PM on Air India flight crashThe UK Prime Minister, Keir Starmer, has responded to the crash of a London-bound plane in Ahmedabad. Around 53 British nationals were also onboard on this flight. He also expressed his sympathies with the families of those who had onboarded the flight.

Loud blast, smoke, debris all over: Eyewitness account of Air India crashA man who rushed to the Air India crash site in Ahmedabad said he saw thick smoke and scattered debris after hearing a massive explosion.

Who is Indian-origin doctor Bobby Mukkamala to head US medical bodyAn Indian-origin doctor was sworn in as the president of the American Medical Association, becoming the first person of Indian-descent to lead America's most influential physician organisation. Bobby Mukkamala, who has roots in Andhra Pradesh, expressed concern about the US healthcare system and vowed to work on it as he took charge of the medical body.

As Air India flight crashes, a look at checks planes undergoAn Air India flight carrying 242 people crashed soon after it took off from Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport in Ahmedabad on Thursday.

Shocked and deeply saddened: Gautam Adani after Air India plane crash in AhmedabadOn Thursday afternoon, an Air India flight heading to London crashed just minutes after take-off, with 242 people on board. The flight, AI-171, was being operated by a Boeing 787 Dreamliner.

Bhopal bridge with 90-degree turn stumps people, officials defend designA new railway overbridge in Bhopal has stirred controversy due to its sharp 90-degree turn, raising safety concerns among locals. Officials cite land constraints and metro station proximity as reasons for the unusual design.

Ahmedabad plane crash: Allu Arjun, Akshay Kumar, Alia Bhatt, celebs mourn the lossAn Air India flight bound for London crashed five minutes after take-off from Ahmedabad airport on Thursday afternoon. Shortly after the news broke, concerns, support, and prayers began pouring in from film celebrities, including Allu Arjun, Akshay Kumar, Alia Bhatt, Riteish Deshmukh and Randeep Hooda, among others.

Ex-Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani on Air India flight that crashed in AhmedabadAhmedabad plane crash: Former Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani was on the London-bound Air India aircraft that crashed near the Ahmedabad airport. According to the passenger list document accessed by India Today Digital, "Vijay Ramniklal Rupani" is the 12th passenger on the list and was booked in the Z class, which falls under the Business Class category.

Air India crash: Ministers, leaders express shock, London Mayor deeply distressedReactions from all over the world poured in after an Air India flight to London crashed shortly after take-off from Ahmedabad, leaving the nation stunned and rescue operations underway.

Pilots flying crashed Air India flight had 9,300 hours of flying experienceWhile Captain Sumeet Sabharwal had 8,200 hours of flying experience, his copilot, Clive Kundar, had 1,100 hours under his belt, the civil aviation regulatory body further said.

Sobhita Dhulipala and Naga Chaitanya stun at Akhil-Zainab reception. PicsActors Sobhita Dhulipala and Naga Chaitanya stole the spotlight at Akhil Akkineni and Zainab Ravdjee's wedding reception in Hyderabad. Pictures from the event show the duo posing with the newlyweds along with their Akkineni family.

Perseverance rover captures breathtaking view of Martian moon DeimosPerseverance's camera employed its maximum long-exposure setting of 3.28 seconds for each of 16 individual frames. These were combined onboard into a single composite image.

China makes a mickey out of DonaldWith protests erupting in Los Angeles and other US cities over immigration raids, the Chinese state media has seized the opportunity to mock the Trump government, capitalising on a crisis that Washington appears to have handed over on a silver platter.

Four accused in Bengaluru stampede case granted interim bailThe Karnataka High Court has granted interim bail to all four accused in the Chinnaswamy Stadium stampede case. The court,  however, directed all accused to surrender their passports.

However, most of them are often routine and manageable. This article explains what these notices really mean, why they're sent, and what you should do if one lands your way.

Iran not in compliance with nuclear obligations: UN nuclear watchdogThe IAEA's 35-nation Board of Governors declared Iran in breach of its non-proliferation obligations, for the first time in almost 20 years.

sports.headline: Out or not out? David Bedingham survives the handle-the-ball appeal in WTC finalSouth Africa batter David Bedingham found himself in the middle of a rare on-field controversy during the World Test Championship final against Australia.

Watch: Labuschagne's stunning two-handed catch helps Australia remove BavumaWTC final, Australia vs South Africa: Marnus Labuschagne took a blinder of a catch at covers to help remove South Africa's Temba Bavuma just when he looked to attack the Aussie bowlers. South Africa were reeling at 121 for 5 at Lunch on Day 2 in London.

Radha Yadav replaces injured Shuchi Upadhyay in India squad for England tourRadha Yadav comes in as the injury replacement for Shuchi Upadhyay, who was ruled out due to a left shin injury ahead of India Women's upcoming white-ball tour of England. Radha Yadav has not played an international match since December 2024.

Wimbledon prize money increased to record number ahead of 2025 campaignWimbledon has increased its total prize money by 7 percent to a record 53.5 million pounds this year. The tournament will also replace traditional line judges with an electronic system, marking a historic change.

Absolutely devastated: Indian sports stars react to Air India plane crash in AhmedabadAn Air India flight from Ahmedabad to London crashed shortly after take-off on Thursday. Indian sports stars, including Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and PV Sindhu, reacted to the tragic incident that has left the world in shock.

Shubman Gill needs time to rise, captains are not made in 1-2 months: Harbhajan SinghFormer India cricketer Harbhajan Singh has backed Shubman Gill to succeed as Test skipper, but said that the youngster will need some time to rise.

Steve Smith embarrassed after being dismissed by part-timer Markram in WTC finalSteve Smith was not pleased after his dismissal to Aiden Markram in the first innings of the WTC Final. The Aussie was unable to comprehend how he got out to a part-time bowler.

AUS vs SA Live: Cummins rtattles South Africa with twin strikes after LunchAustralia vs South Africa WTC Final 2025 Day 2 Live: David Bedingham and Kyle Vereyenne continue their vigil at the crease as South Africa resume play after lunch. The deficit is below hundred and the duo needs to consolidate the innings.

Starc's big match temperament in WTC Final leaves Steyn in aweDale Steyn hailed Mitchell Starc's ability to turn up when it matters the most and explained the reason behind the Aussie's success in the big games.

Gael Monfils hits back at angry bettors: We both know I'm s**t, yet you bet on meGael Monfils responded strongly to abusive social media comments following his Stuttgart Open defeat. He condemned racial abuse and urged trolls to keep his family out of their anger.

Labuschagne makes Pietersen frustrated: Not there to leave ball all dayKevin Pietersen was left frustrated by Marnus Labuschagne's batting intent on Day 1 of the World Test Championship final between Australia and South Africa on Wednesday, June 11. Labuschagne was timid with his approach and left a lot of deliveries.

Gill gets called 'self-obsessed' by fans for having 'Prince' engraving on batStar India batter Shubman Gill is being called 'self-obsessed' by fans for having 'Prince' engraved on his bat. Gill is set to use his new bat in the England series beginning from June 20.

AB de Villiers recalls RCB's painful 18-year wait for IPL trophy in emotional videoLegendary South Africa batter AB de Villiers recalled Royal Challengers Bengaluru's (RCB) emotional journey to maiden Indian Premier League (IPL)  triumph in an emotional video.

Webster looked completely ready in WTC Final: Ponting praises all-rounderRicky Ponting praised Beau Webster for his vital knock during Day 1 of the World Test Championship final on Wednesday, June 11. Webster top scored for Australia to power them to 212 runs as he saw them through a rough period.

Start fighting every ball: Shubman Gill, Gautam Gambhir huddle talk before England TestsIndia coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Shubman Gill inspired the full squad ahead of the England tour with some pep talk. The Indian team is set to embark on a new era under the leadership of Gambhir and Gill in Tests.

WTC Final: Timid or outclassed? South Africa's batting on Day 1 sparks debateAUS vs SA, WTC Final: South Africa squandered a strong start in the big final in London as their batters showed a lack of intent, drawing criticism from former players like Matthew Hayden and Dale Steyn. Despite Kagiso Rabada's five-wicket haul, Australia ended Day 1 on top.

Neither Gill nor Nair: Ex-coach suggests new No. 3 options for England TestsSanjay Bangar feels that neither Shubman Gill nor Karun Nair will be playing at No.3 for India during the Test series against England. Bangar feels that it could be a toss-up between two potential debutants for the spot.

Not the ideal start, but still a lot of cricket left to be played: Kagiso RabadaSouth Africa fast bowler Kagiso Rabada acknowledged that his team hasn't got off to the best of starts with the bat on Day 1 of the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025. Rabada helped South Africa dismiss Australia for 212, and they later finished the day on 43/4.

Australia are in a good position, despite not getting a big total: Steve SmithStar Australia batter Steve Smith is delighted with his team's position in the WTC Final 2025 against South Africa at the end of Day 1, despite not having enough runs on the board. South Africa are reeling at 43/4 at the end of Day 1 in reply to Australia's first innings score of 212.

Kagiso Rabada acknowledges doping mistake following stellar show in WTC FinalSouth Africa fast bowler Kagiso Rabada recalled his doping ban following a stellar five-wicket haul on Day 1 of the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025 against Australia.

Steve Smith left 'surprised' by South Africa's DRS blunder against Beau WebsterStar Australia batter Steve Smith said he was left surprised by South Africa not opting to go for DRS for a close lbw shout against Beau Webster during Day 1 of the World Test Championship (WTC) final at Lord's.

Why Manolo Marquez's India stint proves FIFA Career Mode isn't real lifeIndian football tried to play Career Mode in real life—handing one man two jobs, but now it's all gone glitchy. No wins, no goals, no direction. Time to uninstall the experiment.

Nitish Reddy is skillful with ball, want to see him bowl more in Tests: Morne MorkelNitish Kumar Reddy has the knack for delivering "magical" balls, but India's bowling coach Morne Morkel believes the young all-rounder must take on greater bowling responsibility to truly complement his batting prowess.

Sreeja Akula leads Jaipur Patriots to maiden UTT semi-final with 9-6 winUndefeated Sreeja Akula starred as she sealed Jaipur Patriots' maiden UTT semi-final berth with a 9-6 win over PBG Pune Jaguars—her Clarke-like dominance continuing a season of brilliance under the bright lights at Ahmedabad's EKA Arena.

India will come with high hopes, England looking forward to battle: McCullumEngland head coach Brendon McCullum said he is clear about the direction he wants to take his Test side as they brace for a stern challenge from India in what promises to be a demanding summer of cricket.

Australia tough to beat: Beau Webster hails bowlers for WTC Final startBeau Webster's gritty 72 and Australia's fiery bowling fightback, led by Mitchell Starc, flipped the momentum on Day 1 of the WTC Final, as South Africa's top order crumbled under relentless pressure at Lord's.

Australia fight back with pace on 14-wicket Day 1 after Kagiso Rabada specialWTC 2025 final: Australia fought back, picking four South African wickets on a lively Lord's pitch on Day 1. Earlier in the day, Kagiso Rabada's five-wicket haul helped the first-time finalists dismiss Australia for 212.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
